model
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  model.Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
ComputerPlayer, HumanPlayer
public abstract class Player
extends Object

Abstract class Player Represents a player in the tron game. A player has a name, position, color and direction. Also he might be alive or dead depending on the state of the game.

Version:
1.1 (17-01-2011)
Author:
Søren Dahlgaard, Daniel Hessellund Egeberg, Martin Nicklas Jørgensen

Constructor Detail

Player

public Player(Color color,
              String name)
Creates a new Player object with the given color and name. The player is alive and has no position/direction on the board - This is specified when the game starts.

Parameters:
color - The color of the player. This is used for drawing.
name - The name of the player.
Method Detail

getColor

public Color getColor()
Gets the color of the player

Returns:
this player's color

getDirection

public Direction getDirection()
Gets the direction the player is currently moving

Returns:
The direction the player is moving

getName

public String getName()
Gets the name of the player

Returns:
this player's name

getPosition

public Position getPosition()
Gets the position of the player

Returns:
The current position of the player.

getPreviousPosition

public Position getPreviousPosition()
Retrieves the previous position of the player

Returns:
The previous position.

getScore

public int getScore()
Retrieves the score of this player.

Returns:
the score

isAlive

public boolean isAlive()
Whether the player is alive or not

Returns:
true if the player is alive, false otherwise.

kill

public void kill()
Kills the player. This ensures that isAlive() returns false.

nextMove

public abstract Direction nextMove(Game game)
The direction of the next move this player wants to do. This method does not perform the move, but only informs the game that the player wants to do this move.

Parameters:
game - The state of the game.
Returns:
The direction of the wished move.

performMove

public void performMove(Direction direction)
Performs a move in a given direction. This changes the direction and the position of the player.

Parameters:
direction - the direction to move.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if called on a dead player

setDirection

public void setDirection(Direction newDirection)
Sets the direction of the player. Should only be used when initialising each player to a direction.

Parameters:
newDirection - A direction to face.

setPosition

public void setPosition(Position position)
Sets the position of the player.

Parameters:
position - The new position of the player.
